reviewText: My mother loves this show. It was given to her by me, as a mother's day gift. She loves scary movies.

As a few people pointed out,  this does not have subtitles,  but it's got good plots and comes off add pretty creepy.  My understanding of Spanish is good enough to follow along,  but even when I can't understand portions, the message is clear.  I'd recommend it for a fan of horror

En efecto, este video no consiste en nada que ayude a los anglos a descifrar los dialogos, como no trae audio en ingles ni leyendas auxiliares. Viene a ser una version mejicana puesta al dia (para las mentalidades enfermizas actuales) de Twilight Zone o bien The Outer Limits. El primer episodio viene a ser caracteristico de los demas: gente de solida clase media y de raza blanca (como los protagonistas de las telenovelas) que, en un momento de ensueno, sufre, y luego vuelve a sufrir aun mas. El detalle del fenotipo carezce, obviamente, de verosimiltud a la hora de clasificar a los mejicanos, en buena parte de raza mestiza, pero, en este caso, podemos darnos por contentos al observar que la senora no es "rubia de frasquito". Mas me llamo la atencion el trato almibarado entre marido y esposa en su salida y en el trayecto hasta darse el accidente. Fuera del infeliz resultado de tanto bobeo en si, luego de unos 10 anos de vida conyugal, estaba el hecho de hacerlo en un vehiculo en movimiento a alta velocidad. Estos comentarios los pongo para la consideracion de quienes me leen en espera de que sepan mirar mas alla del fondo superficial de los dramones cinematicos de hoy.

I purchased this for my library because we have a large Hispanic population, most of whom enjoy their horror.  We also have lots of horror affecionados who DON'T speak Spanish. The vendor I purchased from had some good reviews and mentioned that there were English subtitles.  YAY!!!!!

And then I brought it home and watched...and am watching it still...but...no English subtitles.  I know enough Spanish to keep up in some spots, but in others...not so much.  I am SO disappointed because I KNOW there are a lot of folks who will take this out and be equally as disappointed.  What frosts me most, though, is that all our AMerican horror films carry subtitles in Spanish...couldn't this company return the favor?

 I want to give it five stars because a couple of the stories actually scared me out of my jaded little funk...but with the false advertising thing, I just can't.

The little I have viewed of this product appears to be a relatively good production effort. Unfortunately, the reason I have viewed only a portion of this product is because I do not speak nor do I read Spanish. And, as the person commenting before me said, the technical information leads you to believe it has subtitles. I gave the film one star, not because I hate the film (as one star indicates), but for the reason I already mentioned. I am very disappointed.
